discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Wildbanana is actually correct this time - On older windows versions any task that runs will spawn a ‚Äútaskeng.exe‚Äù (short for Task Engine) process and the ‚Äútaskeng.exe‚Äù process will spawn the executable(s) requested by the task. So if you was investigating this you woiuld want to look for when the scheduled task was registered.

Selected Answer: C
checked in docs

Answer : I will pick A, because the Process Tree View , it is visualization.

First in the "Full Detection Details" view, it only have five tags/views : Details, Process table, Process tree, Process graph, Events timeline

so B, must be incorrect, because the name is not correct.

the C & D, the wording or meaning is same. But in the Process Table View, it have a long list of the process, if you select / click the process, it will show you some of the detail or summary only, not the full detail list. And the full detail in the box next to this page.

so i think A is the better answer.

Selected Answer: D
The Full Detection Details option in CrowdStrike provides a detailed list of detection events via the Process Tree View1.
